overview: Shimla, the capital of Himachal Pradesh, is a popular hill‑station known for its cool climate, Victorian architecture, and scenic views from the Mall, Ridge and surrounding hills. It attracts summer tourists, honeymooners and history enthusiasts.
bestTimeToVisit: April to June (summer) – pleasant temperatures and clear skies; spring (March‑April) and autumn (October‑November) are also good for fewer crowds.
travelTips: Use the two official Tourist Information centres (near Victory Tunnel and Bye‑pass road) for reliable guidance.
Local buses cost about ₹10; the Old ISBT and New ISBT connect to major cities and nearby towns.
Traffic is banned on the Mall; use the lifts to reach it and enjoy a calm atmosphere.
Carry some cash for small purchases and bus fares; many smaller shops may not accept cards.
Dress in layers – evenings can be chilly even in summer, and winters are below freezing.
Avoid touts; official information is available at the Himachal Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation office at Scandal Point.
